document.masterDocTitle: Phytoseiid mites of the tribe Paraseiulini Wainstein (Acari: Phytoseiidae) from sub-Saharan Africa

subSubSection.paragraph: FEMALE. (Specimens measured. South Africa : Holotype , 2 paratypes and 5 non-type specimens)
Peritreme. Extending almost to level of j 1 .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 10.
Kuzinellus neosentus
(Van der Merwe): A. Female dorsal shield; B. Female ventral surface; C. Spermatheca; D. Female chelicera; E. Female leg IV; F. Spermatodactyl; G. Male ventrianal shield.

subSubSection.paragraph: Venter. Sternal shield smooth, with 2 pairs of setae (ST 3 inserted on membrane); posterior margin slightly concave; distances between ST 1 -ST 3 63 ( 56â€“69 ) [ 63 ], ST 2 -ST 2 47 ( 41â€“51 ) [ 45 ]. Genital shield smooth; distance between ST 5 -ST 5 57 ( 54â€“60 ) [ 54 ]. Ventrianal shield smooth, vase-shaped, constricted laterally at level of preanal pores, anterior margin straight, 113 ( 105â€“123 ) [ 109 ] long, 66 ( 62â€“72 ) [ 70 ] wide at level of ZV 2, 67 ( 60â€“73 ) [ 70 ] wide at level of anus; setae JV 2 and JV 3 present; round preanal pores posterior to and in longitudinal line with JV 2 . Caudoventral setae smooth and sharp-tipped.
Chelicera. Movable digit 22 ( 19â€“23 ) long, with 1 tooth; fixed digit 22 ( 17â€“23 ) long, with 3 teeth and a pilus dentilis .
Spermatheca. Calyx funnel-shaped, 22 ( 15â€“31 ) [ 20 ] long; atrium small, c-shaped.

Legs. Sharp-tipped macroseta: St
IV 23
( 22â€“24 ) [ 23 ]. Chaetotaxy: genu II: 2 - 2 / 1, 2 / 0-1 ; genu III: 1-2 / 1, 2 / 0-1 .

Dorsum. Dorsal shield and setal patterns as in female, 253 long and 139 wide. Setae j 1 14 , j 3 20 , j 4 17 , j 5 17 , j 6 19 , J 2 23 , J 5 11 , z 2 18 , z 3 21 , z 4 21 , z 5 19 , z 6 19 , Z 4 29 , Z 5 28 ,
s 4 20
,
s 6 22
,
S 2 26
,
S 4 25
,
S 5 25
, r 3 20 , R 1 19 .
Peritreme. Extending almost to level of j 1 .

Venter. Ventrianal shield subtriangular, mostly smooth with few striae anteriorly and around anus, 94 long, 122 wide at the anterior corners; with 4 pairs of preanal setae (JV 1 -JV 3 and ZV 2 ), 3 pairs of lyrifissures, all laterad of ZV 2 and 1 pair of round preanal pores posteromesad to JV 2 . Caudoventral setae smooth and sharp-tipped.
Spermatodactyl. Spindle shaped from a lateral view or slightly curved from a lateral view, shaft 19 long.

Legs. Sharp-tipped macroseta: St
IV 18 .
Chaetotaxy of genua II and III same as in female.

Specimens examined. South Africa :
Holotype female, 1 paratype female associated with
Ceroplastes mimosae
on
Acacia karroo , Pienaarspoort
near Pretoria, Gauteng Province,
3 -I- 1963
, E.A. Ueckermann, C.J. Cilliers; 1 paratype female associated with eriophid galls on
Prunus
sp., Barberton, Mpumalanga Province,
22 -XI- 1962
, P. le S. Milstein; 1 paratype male from
Acacia arabica, Punda Maria, Kruger
National Park, Limpopo Province,
7 -I- 1964
, M.K.P. Smith Meyer;
1 female
from an unidentified tree, Kloof near Durban, Kwazulu/ Natal ,
13 -IX- 1966
, G.G. van der Merwe;
2 females
from
A. karroo
, 80 km from Kuruman to Vryburg, Northern Cape Province,
10 -X- 1979
, E.A. Ueckermann;
1 female
from
Acacia mellifera
, 25 km from Kuruman to Hotazel, Northern Cape Province, Northern Cape Province,
3 -X- 1979
, E.A. Ueckermann;
1 female
from
Albizia harveyi , Komatipoort
, Mpumalanga Province,
5 -II- 1985
, E.A. Ueckermann; all deposited at NCA-PPRI.
